30.heading: Webcomics.
30.title: Real Life : the Complete Year One Collection
30.author: Greg Dean.
notes: "If you're looking for realism, look no further! That's what 'Real Life' is all about! Heck, every character in the comic is based on a real person! Follow the life of Greg and his friends as they battle the everyday rigors of life, from going camping, to playing the latest video games, to traveling through time to 14 century France. As our heroes battle sentient computer programs, you're right there alongside them, thinking 'That could be me!' Well, that's what we're here for. After all, truth is funnier than fiction."
"Every strip from the entire first year, presented exactly as it appeared online, with added commentary by the cartoonist."

35.heading: Webcomics.
35.title: Unshelved
35.author: Bill Barnes and Gene Ambaum.
notes: Printed version of the daily Internet comic strip.

"At the Mallville Public Library they've seen it all. Like Naked Ned, who takes freedom of expression to new lengths. Or Merv, who does everything in the library but read. Or Buddy the Book Beaver, ex-con tree surgeon turned summer reading program mascot. Or the missing books that keep showing up on eBay. Or the amorous teenagers who won't take it outside. In all this chaos and insanity, who ya gonna call? Why, a librarian of course. But please, do it quietly."

40.heading: Webcomics--Articles About.
40.title: "Un Chat, un Roi, des Écrans"
40.author: Vincent Baudoux
40.appears_in: p. 46-49 in 9e Art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 8 (Jan. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Le site When I Am King, consididéré comme référence par les créateurs de narrations en ligne, revendique des racines dans les formes traditionnelles de la bande dessinée et de l'animation. Ce qui en fait un parfait trait d'union entre l'état le plus classique de ce médium et les formes les plus actuelles du numérique."

English summary (from p. 150): "A Cat, a King, Some Screens. Vincent Baudoux speaks highly of the site of the young Swiss artist Demian5 'When I Am King,' which is considered a landmark by on-line narrative creators. He highlights a reminiscency of Felix the Cat and The Little King and situates this cyber-comic in the wake of Scott McCloud's reflections."

111.heading: Weber, Patrick.
111.title: "CREA BD : Le Role Ambigu d'une Asbl"
111.author: Patrick Weber
111.appears_in: p. 48-50 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 72 (Nov./Dec. 1986).
notes: Item on the difficulty of creating an organization to promote comics in Liège.

112.heading: Weber, Patrick.
112.title: "Les Humanos Helvétisés"
112.author: propos recueillis par Patrick Weber
112.appears_in: p. 60-64 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 88 (Mar. 1990).
notes: Article on Humanoïdes Associés, including a brief interview with Fabrice Giger.

113.heading: Weber, Patrick.
113.title: "Michel de Grand Ry : Des Collections pour Toutes les Saisons"
113.author: propos recueillis par Patrick Weber
113.appears_in: p. 41-43 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 74 (Mar./Apr. 1987).

114.heading: Weber, Paul J.
114.title: "Dear Uncle Creepy" p. 4 in Creepy, no. 78
114.author: [No author]
notes: Letters to the editor from Ed O'Reilly, Mike Rutter, Paul J. Weber, Jeff Dunevitz, Louis Grifty, Brian Caden, John Brignoli, Alex Johnson, and Bill Heller.

115.heading: Weber, Rennie C.
115.title: Being Safe is Smart : Coloring & Activities Book
115.author: written by Rennie C

119.heading: Weber, Steve.
119.title: "The Three Sandmen"
119.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
119.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 42 (Sept. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives v. 1.
notes: Sandman origin details given (he was in the service six years ago) ; villain Teeter Sneed is introduced and dies ; introduction of Dr. Clyde Dunlap and Happy O'Shea, who with Wes Dodds make up the "three Sandmen" ; introduction of Steve Weber.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

122.title: Webcomics
notes: Comics originating in electronic form on websites. See also Kevin and Kell .
